###########################################################################################
# Joint estimation of relative risk of dengue and Zika infections
# Journal of Emerging Infectious Diseases
#
# Model 6 - Departmental level. WinBUGS 1.4 code, data, and initial values.
#
# Adapted from: 
#
# Ma H and Carlin BP (2005) Bayesian Multivariate Areal Wombling for Multiple Disease
# Boundary Analysis. Technical Report. School of Public Health, University of Minnesota. 
# url: http://www.biostat.umn.edu/âˆ¼brad/software/mc.pdf
###########################################################################################


model {
	
    for (i in 1:N) {			
	y1[i] ~ dpois(mu1[i])
	y2[i] ~ dpois(mu2[i])

	ynew1[i] ~ dpois(mu1[i])
	ynew2[i] ~ dpois(mu2[i])

	log(mu1[i]) <- log(E1[i]) + a0[1]+  phi[i]*lambda + psi[1,i] 
	log(mu2[i]) <- log(E2[i]) + a0[2]+  phi[i]/lambda + psi[2,i]
	 
	RR1[i]<- mu1[i]/E1[i]
	RR2[i]<- mu2[i]/E2[i]
	}
		
	# Spatial priors (CAR) for the disease-specific random effects
	for (k in 1:2) {
				psi[k,1:N] ~ car.normal(adj[], weights[], num[], tau[k])		# spatial disease-specific effects
	}   
	# Spatial priors (CAR) for the shared random effects
	phi[1:N] ~ car.normal(adj[], weights[], num[], tauS)			# spatial shared random effects  	
	
	for (k in 1:sumNumNeigh) {	weights[k] <- 1 	}

	for (k in 1:2) {
		a0[k] ~ dflat() 

		sigma[k] ~ dunif(0,10)
		tau[k]  <- 1/(sigma[k]*sigma[k])

		}                


		sigmaS ~ dunif(0,5)
		tauS  <- 1/(sigmaS*sigmaS)

	lambda ~ dnorm(0,0.01)
		   				   		
	useless<-sum(R[1,])+sum(mu.phiS[])

#residuals

for (i in 1:N) { 
	e1[i]	<- (y1[i]-mu1[i])/sqrt(mu1[i])
	e2[i]	<- (y2[i]-mu2[i])/sqrt(mu2[i])
}

# predictive check on overdispersion
# OVERDISPERSION

Diagobs1 <- pow(sd(y1[1:N]),2)/mean(y1[1:N])
Diagnew1 <- pow(sd(ynew1[1:N]),2)/mean(ynew1[1:N])
PrCh1    <- step(Diagnew1-Diagobs1)

Diagobs2 <- pow(sd(y2[1:N]),2)/mean(y2[1:N])
Diagnew2 <- pow(sd(ynew2[1:N]),2)/mean(ynew2[1:N])
PrCh2    <- step(Diagnew2-Diagobs2)

}

# DATA

7.40000E+01, 8.60000E+01), sumNumNeigh=4.48000E+02, R= structure(.Data= c(2.00000E-01, 0.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00, 2.00000E-01), .Dim=c(2, 2)), mu.phiS=c(0.00000E+00, 0.00000E+00))

# INITIAL VALUES
